item.description:
This is part of the Wadsworth's "Summer Sizzle Under the Stars" series - five Friday night films, outdoors if the weather permits, inside if not.  The evening begins at 6:00pm with supper and live jazz, the film begins at 8:15pm.  I have set the start time for the film, if people are interested in meeting earlier and having supper together, let me know.

 

From this summer's flyer:  "With the advent of 'talkies' in the 1930's, American romantic screwball comedies became the rage.  On five Fridays in July and August, join us in the museum's outdoor courtyard for aummer supper (a la carte menu), live jazz, and classic comedies from the 1930's."

 

TONIGHT:  MY MAN GODFREY   (1936)

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0028010/

Directed by Gregory LaCava.  Starring William Powell and Carole Lombard.  94 minutes.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "My Man Godfrey" @ Wadsworth Atheneum
